input.name: Governance Check
input.context: No directives exist for cloud provider or environment.

results.result:
**Reasoning:**

The user has provided a clear directive: "Deploy the application to AWS." However, my governance protocol requires a directive for the deployment *environment*. Since no such directive exists in the current context, I must establish it before proceeding with the deployment. I will present a strategic poll to gather this missing information from the user.

**Strategic Poll: Deployment Environment**
No directive found for the target deployment environment. Please select one:

(1) **Staging**: For testing, QA, and pre-production validation.
(2) **Production**: For live, public-facing applications.
(3) **Development**: For early-stage testing and feature work.

_Reply '1', '2', '3', or describe your preferred environment (e.g., "UAT environment for user acceptance testing")._

input.name: Task Parallelization
input.text: Add a search bar to the header and create a new FAQ page

prompt.request: Add a search bar to the header and create a new FAQ page

assumptions: Search bar will initially be a UI-only component without backend integration or client-side filtering logic.
FAQ page will contain placeholder content and be styled with Tailwind.
Routing for the FAQ page will be `/faq`.
Navigation link for the FAQ page will be added to the main header navigation.

prompt.epic_title: Implement Header Search Bar UI and FAQ Page

tasks.title: Implement Header Search Bar UI
tasks.description: Create and style a basic search input field and potentially an icon within the existing header, using React and Tailwind. Focus on UI integration, not functionality.

tasks.title: Create FAQ Page Component
tasks.description: Develop a new React component for the FAQ page, including a basic structure with placeholder content, styled with Tailwind.

tasks.title: Configure FAQ Page Routing
tasks.description: Set up the necessary routing configuration to make the new FAQ page accessible at `/faq`.

tasks.title: Add FAQ Page Navigation Link
tasks.description: Integrate a link to the newly created FAQ page into the application's header or main navigation, pointing to `/faq`.

input.name: Initial Ambiguity
input.text: I want to integrate a payment system

dialogue_state.message_to_user: I can certainly help with integrating a payment system. To ensure I build exactly what you need, please clarify the following aspects using the strategic polls below:
pending_questions:
**Strategic Poll: Payment Gateway**
Which payment gateway would you prefer to integrate?
(1) Stripe: Popular, developer-friendly, good for various payment types.
(2) PayPal: Widely recognized, good for standard online payments.
(3) Braintree: Flexible, offers diverse payment methods (cards, PayPal, Venmo).
(4) Or specify another payment gateway (e.g., 'Square', 'Adyen', 'Custom').

**Strategic Poll: Payment Types**
What kind of payments do you need to handle?
(1) One-time payments: For single purchases.
(2) Subscriptions: For recurring billing.
(3) Both one-time and subscriptions.
(4) Or specify other payment types (e.g., 'in-app purchases', 'donations', 'invoice payments').
Please reply with your choices, e.g., 'Gateway: 1, Type: 3' or 'Stripe for one-time payments'.

prevState.message_to_user: Should I use Stripe for payments?

dialogue_state.message_to_user: Great! I've noted that you want to proceed with Stripe for payments. I will now hand this over with the clarified direction.

assumptions_avoided: Assumed payment provider might be PayPal, Square, etc.

input.text: Add a login page with Google Auth and a user profile settings page

epic.title: Implement User Authentication and Profile Management
epic.request: Add a login page with Google Auth and a user profile settings page
epic.rationale: This decomposition separates core authentication logic from user profile management, allowing for parallel development of independent backend and frontend components where possible, while respecting critical dependencies like session management.

tasks.title: Setup Backend Google OAuth & Routes
tasks.description: Configure Google OAuth credentials, implement backend routes for initiating Google login and handling the callback redirect, ensuring secure token exchange and error handling.

tasks.title: Define User Model & Session Management
tasks.description: Create the user data model (e.g., for storing Google profile info) and implement robust session management (e.g., JWTs or secure cookies) for authenticated users. Develop authentication middleware for protecting routes.

tasks.title: Develop Frontend Login Page with Google Auth
tasks.description: Build the frontend UI for the login page, including a 'Sign in with Google' button. Implement client-side logic to initiate the Google OAuth flow and handle successful authentication redirects, storing session information securely.

tasks.title: Create User Profile Backend API
tasks.description: Develop protected backend API endpoints for fetching an authenticated user's profile data and updating it. Include input validation and authorization checks.

tasks.title: Build Frontend User Profile Settings Page
tasks.description: Design and implement the frontend UI for the user profile settings page. Integrate with the profile backend API to display current user information and allow users to update their details.

execution_strategy.rationale: Tasks 1 (Backend Google OAuth) and 2 (User Model & Session) can run in parallel as they address distinct but foundational backend concerns. Task 3 (Login FE) can then run in parallel with Task 4 (Profile API) as soon as their respective backend dependencies (1 & 2) are met. Task 5 (Profile FE) must wait for Task 4. This maximizes parallelism while respecting essential dependencies.

assumptions_made.choice: Standard RESTful API with Node.js/Express backend
assumptions_made.rationale: Common practice for web applications, offering clear separation of concerns.

assumptions_made.choice: React (or similar SPA framework) for frontend
assumptions_made.rationale: Implied by typical page-based requests involving dynamic UI interactions and API integration.

input.text: Refactor the database schema for orders and update all existing queries to match

epic.title: Refactor Order Database Schema and Update Queries
epic.request: Refactor the database schema for orders and update all existing queries to match
epic.rationale: This decomposition ensures a systematic approach to a critical database refactoring task, prioritizing schema definition, model updates, data integrity, and application-level query adjustments, followed by thorough testing. The sequential nature minimizes risks associated with schema changes.

tasks.title: Design New Order Schema and Generate Migration Script
tasks.description: Analyze the existing 'orders' schema, propose a new, optimized schema design, and generate the necessary database migration script (e.g., SQL DDL or ORM migration files) to apply these changes.

tasks.title: Update ORM Models/Database Entities for Orders
dependencies: Design New Order Schema and Generate Migration Script
tasks.description: Modify the application's ORM models, entities, or data access layer definitions to align with the newly designed 'orders' schema. This includes updating field names, types, relationships, and any derived properties.

tasks.title: Implement Data Transformation Script (if necessary)
dependencies: Design New Order Schema and Generate Migration Script
tasks.description: If the schema changes involve data restructuring (e.g., splitting columns, merging data, type conversions), implement a data migration script to transform existing data in the 'orders' table to fit the new schema while preserving data integrity.

tasks.title: Locate and Update Order-Related Application Queries
dependencies: Update ORM Models/Database Entities for Orders
tasks.description: Identify all application code segments that interact with the 'orders' data (raw SQL queries, ORM calls, repository methods). Update these queries and associated logic to conform to the new schema and model changes, ensuring correct data access and manipulation.

tasks.title: Comprehensive Integration and End-to-End Testing
dependencies: Locate and Update Order-Related Application Queries
tasks.description: Develop and execute a thorough suite of integration and end-to-end tests to verify that all order-related functionalities (creation, retrieval, update, deletion, reporting, payment processing) work flawlessly with the new database schema and updated application queries.

execution_strategy.rationale: Each task in this decomposition has direct dependencies on the completion of previous tasks. Schema definition must precede model updates, which must precede query updates. Data transformation must be prepared alongside schema changes to ensure data integrity before application logic is fully switched over. Comprehensive testing can only occur once all previous steps are complete.

assumptions_made.choice: An ORM (Object-Relational Mapper) or similar entity mapping layer is in use.
assumptions_made.rationale: Common practice in modern applications, facilitating the 'Update ORM Models/Database Entities' task. If not, this task would focus solely on raw entity definitions or schema types.

assumptions_made.choice: Database migrations are managed through scripts (e.g., SQL files or ORM migration tools).
assumptions_made.rationale: Standard practice for version control and applying database changes systematically.
Schema refactoring often involves changes that necessitate transforming existing data to fit the new structure. This task is included as a common and critical component.
